fields.label: URL
fields.name: url
fields.description: The external URL this link points to

fields.label: Description
fields.name: description
fields.description: Brief description or excerpt of the linked content

fields.name: thumbnailImage
fields.label: Thumbnail Image
fields.description: Preview image for the link (auto-fetched from Open Graph or manually uploaded)

fields.label: Source
fields.name: source
fields.description: Name of the source (e.g., Twitter, YouTube, Medium)

fields.label: Featured
fields.name: featured
fields.description: Display this link in the featured section

fields.label: Riverside Project ID
fields.name: riversideProjectId
fields.description: Optional: The project ID from Riverside API (used as 'projectId' query parameter in API v2 calls). Not required for podcasts hosted externally.

fields.label: Riverside Studio ID
fields.name: riversideStudioId
fields.description: Optional: Studio ID from Riverside (used as 'studioId' query parameter to filter recordings)

fields.label: Category
fields.name: category
fields.description: Select a category for this podcast

fields.label: Featured
fields.name: featured
fields.description: Display this podcast in the featured section (deprecated: use tags instead)

fields.label: Display Order
fields.name: displayOrder
fields.description: Lower numbers appear first (0 = highest priority)

fields.label: Apple Podcasts URL
fields.name: applePodcastsUrl
fields.description: Link to this podcast on Apple Podcasts

fields.label: Spotify URL
fields.name: spotifyUrl
fields.description: Link to this podcast on Spotify

fields.label: RSS Feed URL
fields.name: rssFeedUrl
fields.description: RSS feed URL for this podcast

defaultItem.title: TinaCMS by the numbers
defaultItem.description: TinaCMS is an open-source content management system that allows developers to create and manage content for their websites and applications. It provides a flexible and customizable framework for building content-driven applications.

description.value: References another document, used as a foreign key
